comment:
Remember the HYPE regarding self-driving cars ..284 companies bankrupt after spending $127 Billion,  Nanotechnology, Where is IBM WATSON that defeated in 2011 the two JEOPARDY's greatest champions? 
Large language models such as ChatGPT look impressive. They are based on the SAME IDEA as the Back Propagation algorithm introduced in 1981! What changed is the large data sets and the speed of computers. These programs, however, are still STUPID and they DO NOT UNDERSTAND A SINGLE WORD. THIS IS WHY THEY HALLUCINATE! 
Researchers, businesses, and Human EGO, particularly, Sam Altman HUGE EGO tend to embellish the potential benefit of their ‘ology.’ The media loves the inflated claims and refers to them with sensational headlines. Investors get excited, and the money flows. A few years later, the reality can’t live up to the excitement, and the trustworthiness of the technology is damaged and once again Human Ego will "INVENT" a New HYPE to defraud IGNORANT investors that believe what they read. Does ANYONE even Remember that computers can only manipulate 0s and 1s!

Regarding the fail of USSR. Sam said that the centralized planing was the reason. 
With all the respect, that's not true. Centralzied planning was one of the things thay actually worked, especially during the post war time. Soviets did succeed with the rebuilding of the cities, sending rockets the space, creating powerful and advanced war machine (at that time), building factories, and so on. author: @SurfbyShootin

comment:
Great discussion. On consciousness I agree with Sam, it is not about emotion. I would posit the following necessary properties: 1. sense of self i.e. possessing the concept of 'I'; 2. sense of self as an object over time; 3. sense of the world as other than self; 4. sense of relation between self and world; 5. sense of interaction between self and world; and perhaps 6. Sense of power I possess to make changes in the world. These properties are potentially identifiable and trackable in any model. 
On the alignment problem - one idea could be a morality training stream. This could embed a values set into the heart of any AGI. It seems that unlearning is not a property of such system and harnessing this might be one step in creating and, over time, reinforcing alignment.

comment:
@artieschmidt3039  It's the fact that he hadn't thought of that possibility until Sam said it. He was placing that realization into place, that you could "wrap" multiple AI's into one interface, or more fundamentally that for anyone to think both logically and creatively they must have an internal "debate" of some sort, whether conscious or subconscious, submitting ideas and then refining or rejecting them.

I think regardless there's a good point in Sam's proposal of multiple AI's debating each other. It's the same as multiple humans debating each other. To get a higher quality of thought we need not only more "neurons" but also more layers of thought, more iteration.

comment: I wish you had discussed what sort of datasets had to be excluded in order to make ChatGPT politically correct. They obviously didn’t include sites like 4chan, a site that is reflective of roughly half of American males. ChatGPT also uses a distinctly white dialect. Blacks make up roughly 13% of the population and yet not even a hint of Ebonics can be detected in ChatGPT. It doesn’t reflect Hispanic culture either. It only reflects left wing, government-approved content.

author: @frusia123

comment:
I don't believe AI can ever be conscious. People keep talking about consciousness as if it was a gradient of intelligence - that the model will get more and more intelligent, until it gets conscious. You can't learn to be conscious. There are species nowhere near as intelligent as humans and yet they're very much conscious. 

I know this won't go well with the materialist crowd, but consciousness is  something of a God's spark in creation. When someone dies, their body and brain are still there, yet they no longer work, the consciousness is gone. 

AI is a machine and always will be a machine, it's not going to become conscious, there's only one way in which we can create other conscious beings.
author: @frusia123
